ai.summary: A 10.1 km moderate hike on the Herepath Trail around Otterford, UK. The route blends grassy country lanes, hedgerows, and a short woodland stretch, with gentle elevation changes and scenic countryside views. It's a solid half-day walk suitable for walkers with some experience.
ai.terrain_summary: Rural path network with a mix of grassy trails, compacted dirt, and a short woodland section. Expect gentle ascents and descents, seasonal mud, and occasional uneven ground.
ai.safety_notes: - Check weather and daylight hours before you go. - Wear sturdy boots and clothing appropriate for the conditions. - Carry a map and compass or GPS; don’t rely on mobile signal in remote sections. - Bring water and snacks; inform someone of your plan. - Be aware of livestock on rural paths and keep dogs under control. - Stay on marked paths and watch for uneven terrain.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map and compass or GPS device
Headlamp or flashlight (in case of late finish)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March through October) offers the most comfortable conditions, with longer daylight and drier trails; winter visits are possible but expect mud, cold weather, and shorter daylight.

seo.title: Herepath Trail – Otterford: 10.1 km Moderate UK Hike
seo.meta_description: Discover the Herepath Trail in Otterford, a 10.1 km moderate hike in the UK. Learn about the terrain, safety tips, gear, best seasons, and planning essentials.
